intro: Chaerophyllum involucratum, commonly known as the clustered cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and habitat diversity.
